metadata.synopsis: Avatar and Astarion disucss partial ceremorph

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: Don't look at me like that. I know what you're going to say.

24.speaker: Astarion
24.text: Don't look at me like that. I know what you're going to say.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Enter his mind, tempt him with the wonders of your new-found form.

82.text: *Capability. Alacrity. Quickness. The feeling the world was made for you.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Capability. Alacrity. Quickness. The feeling the world was made for you.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Such is the potential of the illithid kind. He sees it. Yet he fears it still.*

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Push into his fear, prove his weakness if he does not accept the tadpole.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: Ugh, yes, you're very impressive. But leave me alone.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: If such power would please you, darling, I won't stop you.

55.speaker: Astarion
55.text: But do be careful. I want you to stay you.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: Good. I look forward to having a formidable ally with no sense of self-preservation.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Unlike you to be so unwilling to receive a new power...

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: That was before I knew the cost. Before I knew it meant transforming into some grotesque beast.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: I remember how it hurt when I turned to a vampire. My body writhed and warped while I was utterly helpless, the grip of death owned my heart as it beat its last.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: I - I don't want to turn into anything else. I can't do that again. I can't watch my body be taken over.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: I'll happily murder my way to whatever powerful artefacts we can make use of. Point at the back and I'll stab.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Just don't ask me to sacrifice my body.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: It hasn't been mine for so long.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: There are worse fates than Cazador out there. You should use the tadpole.

94.speaker: Astarion
94.text: I'm still nothing, aren't I? Just an expandable frail spawn who will burn to a crisp soon enough.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: I'm still nothing, aren't I? Just an expandable frail spawn who will burn to a crisp soon enough.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: A feeble coward is all you shall ever be, unless you become more.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You don't have to use this tadpole. But we are in a lot of danger.

23.speaker: Astarion
23.text: What is there left to protect, if you lose your very body to the monster?

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: All right. Fine. Give me the worm. I will take every weapon I can, damn it all.

27.text: No. We defeated Cazador, we can defeat anyone. This world is ours to do with as we please, now. I will not do this.

8.speaker: Astarion
8.text: No. We defeated Cazador, we can defeat anyone. This world is ours to do with as we please, now. I will not do this.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Your illithid powers are the only reason you can stand up to Cazador. This will help you defeat him.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Tell me of the weakest moment you ever felt in those two hundred years.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: *As you pick apart his mind, you discover his worst memory. That which brings him the purest terror.*

29.text: *As you pick apart his mind, you discover his worst memory. That which brings him the purest terror.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *As you pick apart his mind, you discover his worst memory. That which brings him the purest terror.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Complete solitude after being disobedient. Sealed. Buried alive. Voiceless. Will this be forever?*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *A year of horror. Then the release. He will never disobey again.*

42.speaker: Player
42.text: You never want to risk that again. Even if it means becoming part-illithid.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: That forgotten wretch is who you'll be again unless you become more.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I want you to become part-illithid. To protect yourself.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm so sorry for making you remember. Let's drop this.

36.text: Fuck off. I can tell what you're doing. You will not break me down.

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: Fuck off. I can tell what you're doing. You will not break me down.

90.speaker: Astarion
90.text: I don't need a partner who's willing to unleash the demons in my head. You and me are over.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: You're nothing. Just a frail spawn who will burn to a crisp soon enough.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Well, it's up to you, in the end.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: We need to use every advantage our infection has to offer.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: I had nothing for so long. Nothing. Not even my own body. I will not give it up, now it's mine again.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: Break into his mind. Look for a way to convince him.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You're right. You shouldn't compromise yourself.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: I am... not. I just don't want to lose my gods-given good looks, really. Wouldn't that be a crime?

96.speaker: Astarion
96.text: It isn't about the pain... it's about being beholden to the tadpole's influence.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: If we mastered the tadpoles, it would be different. But right now that mastery depends on an illithid and its githyanki slave.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: All right, I will speak no more on the matter.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: Why don't you want to use it?

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I wasn't going to ask you to use it.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: I'm not going to submit to this. Don't ask me again.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: We both know what it is capable of. But I'm not touching it.
